Hi Rihab,

Feel free to reach out with any questions, we are glad people ar=
e
interested on the paper and reproducing it's results.
We are using NoFram=
eskip-v4. We follow the same preprocessing steps as
other methods (Example:=

https://github.com/openai/baselines/blob/master/baselines/common/atari_wra=
ppers.py).
We use the accumulated reward (no discount factor, no clipping).=

You are right on the 20k frames limit as it translates to 5k timesteps
aft=
er the frame skips.

Best regard,
Felipe

On Tue, May 29, 2018 at 1:59 AM, =
Rihab Gorsane rihab.gorsane@...
[neat] <neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote=
:

>
>
> Hi all,
>
> I've begun reproducing the DeepNeuroevolution paper in=
 Pytorch. I've
> considered only the Atari case study to test my algorithm =
on.
> In the paper, it's mentioned that "During training, each agent is
> e=
valuated on a full episode (capped at 20k frames), which can include
> mult=
iple lives and fitness is the final episode reward". Thus I think that
> I =
need to track the number of frames each agent is proceeding and limit its
>=
 evaluation at 20k frames ( 5k frames for my case since I'm doing k=3D4 fra=
me
> skipping technique for some games).
>
> I was wondering if anyone coul=
d tell me which environment Uber was
> wrapping ( -v0 or -v4, doing frame s=
kipping or not) and also for the
> reward, are they just picking the last r=
eward as the fitness score or
> calculating the accumulated reward or doing=
 some reward clipping.
>
> Thank you,
>
> 
>

--000000000000fcee90056d60774b
Content-Type: text/html; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

      <p></p><div dir=3D"ltr"><div>Hi all, =
<br></div><div><br></div><div>I've begun reproducing the DeepNeuroevolu=
tion paper in Pytorch. I've considered only the Atari case study to tes=
t my algorithm on.=C2=A0</div><div>In the paper, it's mentioned that &q=
uot;During training, each agent is evaluated on a full episode (capped at 2=
0k frames), which can include multiple lives and fitness is the final episo=
de reward". Thus I think that I need to track the number of frames eac=
h agent is proceeding and limit its evaluation at 20k frames ( 5k frames fo=
r my case since I'm doing k=3D4 frame skipping technique for some games=
). <br></div><div><br></div><div>I was wondering if anyone could tell me wh=
ich environment Uber was wrapping ( -v0 or -v4, doing frame skipping or not=
) and also for the reward, are they just picking the last reward as the fit=
ness score or calculating the accumulated reward or doing some reward clipp=
ing.</div><div><br></div><div>Thank you,<br></div></div>
<p></p>
